event_description:
Contact Person: Andy Moesch (+41 79 430 80 20)


Please be on time, the bus will leave on time at 07:30.
The Davos organising team welcomes you to the DECTRIS Retreat 2025 in Davos and hands over to Anna-Karin, who will be our moderator for the event. She will interview our CEO Matthias.
Introduction of new employees and presentation of long-term employees.
Let's craft the future of DECTRIS together! In this workshop, we will work in small groups to discuss and develop ideas for the future of DECTRIS. The results will be presented in the second session.

Requires: Laptop


We will work in teams to craft the future DECTRIS products.

Each team will present the results of their crafting session.
Teams in Group I:
  • Photon Pioneers
  • Atomic Architects
  • Byte Builders
  • Laser Engineers
  • Nano Crafters
  • AI Alchemists
  • Singularity Seekers
  • Circuit Breakers
  • Higgs Hunters
  • Fusion Innovators

Each team will present the results of their crafting session.
Teams in Group II:
  • Code Catalysts
  • Data Nomads
  • Free Electrons
  • Ionizing Radiators
  • Valance Voyagers
  • Silicon Dicers
  • Bump Bonders
  • Super Capacitors
  • Charge Carriers
Return gondola rides will be available at 21:30 and 23:00.
There is a later gondola ride at 23:00.
Last gondola back down.

event_name: How is it Made? Batteries & CT
event_description:
Speakers: CarA, SpyG
Language: ENG

Join us in the battery journey.

You will learn how batteries are made, what problems can occur and what fast micro CT and photon counting detectors can do about it.

event_name: From Unconscious Reaction to Conscious Response
event_description:
Speakers: RolB,
Language: DEU

Wir alle erleben täglich Momente, in denen wir automatisch reagieren, sei es in Meetings, beim Schreiben von E-Mails oder im direkten Austausch mit Kollegen.

Der Ausdruck "From unconscious reaction to conscious response", geprägt von Gregg Kendrick und inspiriert von der Gewaltfreien Kommunikation nach Marshall Rosenberg, beschreibt einen entscheidenden Entwicklungsschritt: Wir lernen, innezuhalten, die Situation bewusst wahrzunehmen und dann mit Klarheit und Absicht zu handeln.

Dieser Impulsvortrag lädt ein zu einer kurzen, aber tiefgehenden Reflexion über Selbst- und Sozialkompetenz im Arbeitsalltag, speziell in einem selbstorganisierten Unternehmen wie DECTRIS. Er zeigt auf, wie wir den Raum zwischen Reiz und Reaktion vergrößern können, und was dieser Raum uns ermöglicht: Echtes Zuhören, konstruktives Feedback, kluge Entscheidungen und wertschätzende Zusammenarbeit.

Das vermittelte Konzept bildet einen Rahmen für die Schulungsangebote von PATund TRUST.

Ziel des Vortrags:

In 20 Minuten einen Funken zu setzen, für mehr bewusste Kommunikation, bessere Zusammenarbeit und mehr Freude im Arbeitsalltag.

event_name: BigPicture (Portfolio & Project Planner) | What's in it for me and my team?
event_description:
Speakers: BuSy
Language: ENG

  • What did the the implementation of BigPicture based on Jira achieve, how can you and your team profit from this.
  • What is possible already now, and what will be possible in the future?

event_name: We Cannot Predict the Future, but We Can Craft It
event_description:
Speakers: ValR, TomH, PieZ
Language: ENG

Over the past 20 years, our development of photon and electron detectors has focused on constant improvements in three key areas: ASICs, sensors, and methods and simulations.

DECTRIS’s innovations aim to set new standards in detector technology, meeting the increasing demands of scientific research while also expanding the use of our detectors into new fields and applications.

Starting from the first PILATUS2 ASICs, we have advanced to today’s fast frame rates, high-rate capabilities, low-noise electronics, large area, ensure consistent, scalable manufacturing. At the same time, sensor technology has improved, offering higher quantum efficiency across an energy range from hundreds eV to 100 keV, better spatial resolution, and stability. 

Today, we’re continuing our work on detectors exploring advanced sensors and readout technologies to tackle the challenges of tomorrow’s photon and electron detection. 

This presentation will provide our perspective on the evolution of detector technology, from its origins to current innovations, and discuss potential future directions.

event_name: Great Detectors, Nice Interfaces... What Else?
event_description:
Speakers: DaSt
Language: ENG

The first wave of scientists-customers asks us for outstanding technology, and wishes to have usable interfaces according to the user’s skills. The second wave trusts the former, but asks: “Can you help me getting results as impressive as my neighbor?”.

This presentation aims at initiating a discussion on the role of DECTRIS in applications support and “customer success management”, with focus on to effectively expand to the “second wave” customers and beyond. It includes possible business models and alignment to DECTRIS vision and resources.

Speakers: ThoT
Language: ENG

"Chasing the Holy Grail" metaphorically refers to the pursuit of something highly desired and difficult to achieve, often a goal or objective that is considered extremely important or valuable but also very elusive” (AI)

Making photon-counting market ready for Medical Computed Tomography is exactly that.

event_name: Make Ideas Come to Life: The Power of Speaking and Storytelling
event_description:
Speakers: DanM
Language: ENG
Requires: Laptop or Pen and Paper

In this workshop, we’ll practice creating and delivering impactful stories that make ideas come to life and get them heard.

In a world of AI-generated texts, emails, and reports, the one thing that can’t be replaced is our in-person communication. Public speaking is one of the most important and useful skills to craft our future, boost our careers, and enhance our personal lives.
